pkgmetadata.longdescription: The amdgpu-dkms a package containing both the ROCK-Kernel-Driver and firmware (which is not installed in this package). This package will build the kernel modules using the DKMS framework allowing for version agnostic compatibility meaning that you can compile this package against 4.20.x, 5.0.x, 5.1.x, 5.2.x kernel versions. The amdgpu-dkms package has more GPU features like IPC related features (Memory sharing API, Signal sharing API); increasing GPU system memory limits from 3/8 of system memory to 29/32 of system memory; RDMA (aka Remote Device Programming or ROCmRDMA) to allow other PCIe kernel modules and devices DMA access to GPU memory, KFD (Kernel Fusion Driver) features, and DirectGMA (Direct Graphic Memory Access) support. ROCk is also a core componenet of the ROCm platform. It also adds compatibility for newer hardware if the kernel is old.

use.flag: Checks if ACPI support is enabled in the kernel. Enabling ACPI may enhance multigpu detection with PowerXpress (multigpu laptops), provide more sysfs info, access to ACPI events for laptops, dynamic PCI-e tuning.
Checks if the GPU(s) are supported for ROCk.
Checks if the MMU_NOTIFIER is enabled.
Checks if the PCIe slots are supported for ROCk.
Checks kernel config for DirectGMA support.
Pulls in the firmware packaged with the same driver. (optional if using linux-firmware instead)
Checks if kernel config for proper support for PowerXpress, Hybrid Graphics (i.e. IGP and dGPU on laptop).
Checks if the hardware is compatible with the ROCk kernel driver. (optional)
Checks kernel config for SSG (Solid State Graphics) support.

Fills the IO-LINKS' sysfs interface at /sys/class/kfd/topology/nodes/N/io_links/X/node_to using the NUMA data structure. For more info see https://rocm-documentation.readthedocs.io/en/latest/ROCm_System_Managment/topo3.html#sysfsclasskfdtopologynodes0iolinks01 https://rocm-documentation.readthedocs.io/en/latest/ROCm_System_Managment/ROCm-System-Managment.html#io-links
